meanings.definition: Deceive or trick someone for personal gain.
meanings.sent1: The sneaky salesman defrauded the old lady by selling her a broken watch.
meanings.sent2: The scammer defrauded many people by promising fake prizes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat defrauded the dog by pretending to share its treats.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds defrauded the land of much-needed sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox defrauded the farmer of his chickens with clever tactics.

meanings.definition: Obtain money or property by deception.
meanings.sent1: The con artist defrauded innocent victims of their life savings.
meanings.sent2: The thief defrauded the bank by forging documents.
meanings.sent3: The magician defrauded the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The shadows defrauded the room of its brightness.
meanings.sent5: The pirate defrauded the treasure chest of its jewels under the moonlight.

meanings.sent1: The dishonest contractor defrauded his clients by overcharging for repairs.
meanings.sent2: The impostor defrauded the company by pretending to be a qualified professional.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten defrauded its owner by pretending to be stuck in a tree.
meanings.sent4: The silence defrauded the room of its usual chatter.
meanings.sent5: The clever raccoon defrauded the campers of their snacks by sneaking into their tent.
